thread.title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of August 30, 2015
thread.title_full: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of August 30, 2015

title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of August 30, 2015
text:
Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of August 30, 2015 -- Only Rentrak Provides the Official Global Movie Results -- Rentrak 1 hour ago Content preferences Done 
LOS ANGELES, Aug. 30, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Rentrak (NASDAQ: RENT ), the leader in precisely measuring movies and TV everywhere, today announced the official worldwide weekend box office estimates for the weekend of August 30, 2015, as compiled by the company's theatrical measurement services. 
As the trusted official standard for real-time worldwide box office reporting, Rentrak provides the only theater-level reporting in the world. Customers are able to analyze admissions and gross results around the world using Rentrak's suite of products. 
Rentrak's Senior Media Analyst Paul Dergarabedian commented, "Paramount's 'Terminator: Genisys' earned $23.6 million from 25 international markets, giving the film the top spot on the global chart and delivering an impressive cumulative total in China after just 8 days in release of $82.8 million." 
The top 12 worldwide weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, August 30, 2015, are below. Terminator Genisys - Paramount Pictures - $23.8M Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation - Paramount Pictures - $23.6M Straight Outta Compton - Universal - $19.7M Minions - Universal - $17.8M Hitman: Agent 47 - 20th Century Fox - $16.9M Hundred Regiments Offensive, China Film Group - $16.2M Dead End, The â€“ Bona Film - $14.0M Inside Out - Disney - $12.3M Man From U.N.C.L.E. - Warner Bros. - $10.0M Ted 2 - Universal - $9.3M No Escape - Multiple - $8.6M 
The top 12 domestic weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, August 30, 2015, are below. Straight Outta Compton - Universal - $13.2M War Room - Sony - $11.0M Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation - Paramount - $8.3M No Escape - The Weinstein Company - $8.3M Sinister 2 - Focus Features - $4.7M Man From U.N.C.L.E. - Warner Bros. - $4.4M Hitman: Agent 47 - 20th Century Fox - $3.9M Gift, The - STX Entertainment - $3.1M Jurassic World - Universal - $3.1M Minions - Universal - $2.9M American Ultra - Lionsgate - $2.8M 
Full details regarding the global domestic and international box office results are listed in the table below. Weekend BO Estimate (USD)
